intro: Scilla peruviana, commonly known as the Peruvian scilla, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue to purple flowers. The plant produces narrow, grass-like leaves and blooms in early spring. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens. Scilla peruviana prefers well-drained soil and partial shade to thrive.
